title: Crispy Panko Chicken Breasts Recipe
description: This easy panko chicken recipe results in deliciously crispy pan-fried chicken breasts that are ready to serve in less than 15 minutes!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Meat and Poultry Chicken Chicken Breast Pan-Fried Chicken Crispy Panko Chicken Breasts 4.6 (186) 144 Reviews 67 Photos This panko chicken recipe uses pounded chicken breasts making it quick and easy to cook. Use crushed, crisp rice cereal squares instead of panko crumbs for a gluten-free version! Submitted by Mazola Updated on August 9, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 67 67 67 67 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts 1 egg 1 cup panko crumbs ½ teaspoon Spice Islands® Garlic Powder ½ teaspoon Spice Islands® Onion Powder ½ teaspoon Spice Islands® Fine Grind Sea Salt ¼ teaspoon Spice Islands® Fine Grind Black Pepper ¼ cup Mazola® Corn Oil Directions Pound chicken breasts, one at a time, in a resealable plastic bag until about 1/2-inch thick. Lightly beat egg in a shallow bowl. Combine panko crumbs, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper in a separate shallow bowl. Dip chicken breasts in egg until coated, then dip in panko mixture, pressing chicken into the crumbs until fully coated. Arrange in a single layer on a plate. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until golden brown and cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes per side. I Made It Print 739 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Crispy Panko Chicken Breasts 01 of 67 Photo by  Chef Mo 02 of 67 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 03/11/2025 Tasty - family were very happy with the results! I added some finely chopped ginger with the egg, subtle but may have given it an extra zing 🙂 03 of 67 Photo by  Chef Mo 07/29/2023 Awesome crispy outside of the chicken. Seasoning was good. name: Mazola
instructions: Pound chicken breasts, one at a time, in a resealable plastic bag until about 1/2-inch thick.;Lightly beat egg in a shallow bowl. Combine panko crumbs, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper in a separate shallow bowl.;Dip chicken breasts in egg until coated, then dip in panko mixture, pressing chicken into the crumbs until fully coated. Arrange in a single layer on a plate.;Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until golden brown and cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes per side.
